_header: So noble medicine ne so sovereign
Title(s): ‘How the plage was sesyd in rome’
_description: (?)John Lydgate, ‘How the plage was sesyd in rome’ — one 8-line stanza and five stanzas rhyme royal

BLAdd29729.First Lines:
So noble medesyne ne so sovereyneso speciall stronge gayn ffever
                    pestilens…
BLAdd29729.Last Lines:
…worshipynge this martir he Instillith his gracemoste
                    sovereyne diaprodest in all pestilence case
BLAdd29729.Attributed Author:
‘Iohn lidgat’ (f. 4v); ‘Explicit / Iohn
                    lidgate’ (f. 5) both by scribe (John Stow)
BLAdd29729.Attributed Title:
‘How the plage was sesyd in rome / Iohn lidgat’ (f.
                        4v, by scribe, John Stow)
BLAdd29729.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 159-61.
